title: Is there anyone who came out of social anxiety by any means? - Quora

response.answer_text: With the right therapy and treatment from a psychologist they can come out of it. It is a matter of taking one step at a time and making them believe there is nothing wrong with being among other people. There minds are susceptible to “input” of thought or an idea and they can accept what you tell them. As the others say, it is a long, slow process, but can be achieved as can a lot of mental health issues that are just what people think. It is a kind of mind control, and getting them to believe you are telling them that it is possible. There will be set backs if something upsets them but in the long run it can be fixed and they can lead a “normal” life.

There are many people who were reluctant at first but had made it out of social anxiety. It needs a positive bent of mind towards other people to work on social anxiety. Also, it requires the ability to say ‘No’ when it feels too much to handle. Initially, you may seem a rude person, the ‘non-nice’ person you were presumed to be till that deciding moment. But, with time invested in the social relationship, people’s initial perceptions change. All of the change can be possible only with faith. Here are some TedX links for Social anxiety.
